title: Tag, You’re It: Blog Questions 2025
partialText: Eric tagged me in to answer ten questions about how and why I blog.

title: Don’t Use aria-label on Static Text Elements
partialText: Don’t use the aria-label or aria-labelledby attributes on divs, spans, or other elements representing static/noninteractive text-level semantics, unless you’re also updating roles.

title: Subtitles, Closed Captions, and Open Captions: What’s the Difference?
partialText: A lay of the land of the different kinds of synchronized transcription, featuring a creature with atom rays of superhuman strength.

title: Lost in Translation: Tips for Multilingual Web Accessibility
partialText: Practical tips I wish I’d had for navigating the intersection between web accessibility and internationalization/localization.

title: Build a Blogroll with Eleventy
partialText: A step-by-step guide to adding a blogroll, complete with each blog’s latest posts, to your Eleventy site.

title: I’m a Spotless Giraffe.
partialText: AI models were perplexed by a baby giraffe without spots. They’re perplexed by me, too.

title: How I Write Alt Text for Code Snippets on Social Media
partialText: Because blind and low-vision programmers deserve a little better than “code snippet.”

title: The Curious Case of “iff” and Overriding Screenreader Pronunciations
partialText: Markup hacks to override screenreader pronunciations can get a little iffy. Here’s some techniques to try instead.

title: The Web Needs a Native .visually-hidden
partialText: For years, developers have passed around a set of styles like a magic incantation. It’s time we made it a web standard.

title: Create Shareable Automatic Captions for Live Online Events with Web Captioner
partialText: Stuck using a platform for live online events that doesn’t support captions? Here’s how to generate captions you can share in a few quick steps.

title: A First Look at the Websites and Software Applications Accessibility Act Bill
partialText: Congress just introduced a new bill to ensure digital accessibility for websites and applications. I took a look.

title: Style with Stateful, Semantic Selectors
partialText: See how building with accessible semantics from the get-go can give you expressive, meaningful style hooks for free.

title: How I Doubled My Lighthouse Performance Score in One Night
partialText: I spent some time seeing if I could get my Lighthouse performance score up. Here’s how I fared.

title: How to Fix Your Low-Contrast Text
partialText: Solve 30% of the web’s accessibility defects with just the help of a calculator!

title: Build a Twitch Chatbot for Sharing Your Content Using Algolia Search
partialText: Finding and sharing links to your content in your Twitch chat is now just a command away!

title: Ben’s Humane Guide to Technical Blogging
partialText: Hi. I’m a sporadic technical blogger. Here’s a few things I’ve learned about blogging for fun.

title: On the ‹dl›
partialText: The semantics you didn’t know you needed.

title: Takeaways From “Adapting Comics for Blind and Low Vision Readers: A Roundtable Discussion”
partialText: “Are we adapting the form of comics or the content of comics?”

title: Takeaways From Axe-Con 2021
partialText: What I learned from Axe-Con about automated accessibility testing, design systems, data visualization, organizational influence, and more.

title: I Finally Understand Eleventy’s Data Cascade.
partialText: Where does Eleventy get all of its data? Which data overrules other data? I’ve documented my whole mental model of Eleventy’s data cascade.

title: RSS Readers: Yet Another Case for Semantic Markup
partialText: I found a pleasant surprise in my RSS reader, and it reminded me why I write semantic markup.

title: Implement a Skip Link for Navigation-Heavy Sites
partialText: Add a link to the beginning of your page to help keyboard navigators skip over repeated links.

title: aria-label, aria-labelledby, and aria-describedby: What’s the Difference?
partialText: Diving deep into three attributes that bring clarity to elements in assistive technologies.

title: Out With The Old, In With The New
partialText: How and why I rebuilt my blog from the ground up with Eleventy.

title: Maintaining Focus Outlines for Windows High Contrast Mode
partialText: I’m using outline: 3px solid transparent; from now on.

title: Lexical and Dynamic Scope
partialText: A peek inside the matryoshka dolls that power your programming. Written mainly for JavaScript developers.

title: CSS Can Influence Screenreaders
partialText: How CSS bleeds into content and influences screenreader announcements.

title: New Year, New Terminal: Alias Your Directories the Unix Way
partialText: The trick I use all day to speed up development and make my Unix terminal delightful.

title: New Year, New Terminal: Alias Your Directories the Windows Way
partialText: The trick I use all day to speed up development and make Command Prompt delightful.

title: What Is ARIA?
partialText: A beginner’s guide to ARIA: what it is, what it does, why you should use it... and when you shouldn’t.

title: The Accessibility Tree
partialText: Understanding the flow of page contents from browser to screenreader caused me to radically rethink accessible markup.

title: How (Not) to Build a Button
partialText: When you reinvent the wheel, you might miss a few spokes.

title: How Domino’s Could Topple the Accessible Web – Part 1: Public Accommodations
partialText: The popular pizza chain has a big part to play in the unseen war over the web.
